IRS990ScheduleA.FactsAndCircumstancesTestTxt: COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF CRAWFORD COUNTY, INC.ATTACHMENT TO SCHEDULE A RE: PUBLIC SUPPORT TESTTHE PUBLIC SUPPORT PERCENTAGES FOR THE COMMUNITY FOUNATION OF CRAWFORD COUNTY, INC. (THE FOUNDATION) FOR 2017 AND 2016 ARE 31.53% AND 26.84%, RESPECTIVELY. SINCE THE FOUNDATION'S PUBLIC SUPPORT PERCENTAGE IS LESS THAN 33 1/3 PERCENT FOR THE CURRENT AND PRIOR YEAR, IT FAILS THE MECHANICAL TEST FOR PUBLIC SUPPORT.THEREFORE, THE FOUNDATION MUST PASS THE FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES TEST IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS PUBLIC SUPPORT STATUS. THE FOUNDATION DOES PASS THE FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES TEST FOR 2017. IN ORDER TO PASS THE FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES TEST, THE ORGANIZATION MUST DO THE FOLLOWING:SOURCES OF SUPPORT- THE ORGANIZATION SHOULD SEEK GIFTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS FROM A WIDE BASE OF POTENTIAL DONORS IN THE COMMUNITY THAT IS SERVED. THE FOUNDATION SEEKS CONTRIBUTIONS FROM A VARIETY OF SOURCES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, BUSINESSES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, OTHER PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND OTHER PUBLIC AND PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.REPRESENTATIVE GOVERNING BODY- THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHOULD REPRESENT VARIOUS AREAS OF PUBLIC INTEREST IN THE AREAS SERVED. THE FOUNDATION MAINTAINS A DIVERSE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REPRESENTING MANY INTEREST GROUPS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.AVAILABILITY OF PUBLIC FACILITIES OR SERVICES AND/OR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN PROGRAMS- THE ORGANIZATION SHOULD BE ALWAYS OFFERING ITS SERVICES TO DONORS IN PLANNING THEIR GIVING AND EDUCATING THE PUBLIC ABOUT GRANT MAKING OPPORTUNITIES. THE FOUNDATION UNDERTAKES NUMEROUS INITIATIVES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR TO EDUCATE DONORS ON THE OPTIONS AVAILABLE FOR CHARITABLE GIVING AND ALSO EDUCATES AREA ORGANIZATIONS AND SCHOOLS ON THE FUNDS AVAILABLE ANNUALLY FOR DISTRIBUTION FROM THE ORGANIZATION. ALL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED AT NO COST TO THE DONORS OR GRANT RECIPIENTS. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATION OFFERS A NUMBER OF FORUMS ON COMMUNITY INTEREST ITEMS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR THAT ARE OPEN TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMOUNTS HELD FOR OTHER AGENCIES REPRESENT FUNDS PLACED ON DEPOSIT WITH THE FOUNDATION BY OTHER 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS, BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL BOARD RESOLUTIONS. THE FOUNDATION ACCOUNTS FOR THESE TRANSFERS AS A LIABILITY. INCOME IS ADDED TO THESE FUNDS PERIODICALLY, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOUNDATION'S INVESTMENT ALLOCATION POLICIES. CONTRIBUTIONS BY, INVESTMENT INTEREST CREDITS FOR, AND DISTRIBUTIONS TO THOSE ORGANIZATIONS ARE REFLECTED AS ADJUSTMENTS TO THE LIABILITY ACCOUNT AND ARE NOT REFLECTED ON THE FOUNDATION'S STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES.
TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH MULTIPLE FUND AGREEMENTS

THE ORGANIZATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE) AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(A) OF THE CODE. ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ORGANIZATION AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY IF THE ORGANIZATION HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ORGANIZATION, AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS IN PROGRESS. AS SUCH, THE ORGANIZATION IS GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES. HOWEVER, THE ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO FILE FEDERAL FORM 990 RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX WHICH IS AN INFORMATIONAL RETURN ONLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS ARE DETERMINED ACCORDING TO THE DONOR DESIGNATION OR AS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AMOUNTS AVAILABLE FOR EXPENDITURE, AND UPON GRANT REQUEST AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION FROM THE ORGANIZATION. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, FIELD OF INTEREST/STUDY, AND PARAMETERS OF THE SPECIFIC SCHOLARSHIP FUND. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PAID BY SEMESTER AND REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION OF ACADEMIC STANDARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE CFCC BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO SUBMISSION. THE BOARD VOTES TO APPROVE THE 990 AS PART OF THAT MONTH'S FINANCE REPORT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, AND WITHIN ONE MONTH OF THE START OF THE CFCC'S FISCAL YEAR, EACH BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEMBER SHALL PROVIDE THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE CFCC WITH A LIST OF OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBER HOLD IN CHARITABLE AND BUSINESS ORGANIZATIONS AND SHALL IDENTIFY HIS OR HER PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR PRINCIPLE BUSINESS ACTIVITY. BOARD MEMBERS ABSTAIN OR RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM CONVERSATIONS THAT COULD LEAD TO A POTENTIAL CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE AND COMPENSATION OF ITS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OF ITS KEY EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND POSTED TO CFCC'S WEBSITE.
THIS PROCESS REMAINS THE SAME FOR THE CURRENT YEAR.
